result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew R Makowsky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to probation by 3:00 PM on Friday, January 22, 2016.

miscConds.notes: $100.00 cash bond to be applied. If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count 1 together with conditions.

Defendant Matthew R Makowsky in court with attorney Laura Ann Sutton.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend to 2 misdemeanor counts per 947.01(1) and 946.41(1). Court grants amendment. Defendant pleads guilty to both amended charges. Defense makes recommendation. Defendant makes statement.

SW

Court costs.
